articles.author: Anniek Bao
articles.title: Asia markets open higher after China weekend briefing hints at more stimulus; economic data in focus - CNBC
articles.description: China's deflation pressures deepened in September with consumer prices rising at their slowest pace in three months at 0.4% from a year earlier.
articles.content:
Asia-Pacific markets were mixed on Monday, as investors assessed China's weekend press briefing and awaited a slew of economic data this week from the region.
